privacyAndDataCard.manageDevicesText: See which devices are signed in. Use the button below to log out of selected devices, or log out of all devices using the link.
privacyAndDataCard.deleteAccountText: This will permanently delete your Thunderbird Pro account and Thunderbird Pro services data. You will not be able to reactivate this account.

dashboard.downloadDescription: For a quick and easy setup, we recommend using Thunderbird. Just download the app, enter your email address and password, and you're ready to go.
dashboard.connectYourAccountFirstLine: Many email apps can configure your account automatically. Enter your email address and password to get started.
dashboard.connectYourAccountSecondLine: If setup doesn’t work, try connecting manually using server settings.

emailSettings.changePasswordDescription: Use this password to connect apps that don't support secure sign-in.
emailSettings.changePasswordDescriptionTwo: Once set, it can't be viewed or recovered.
emailSettings.emailAliasesDescription: All emails will deliver mail to your primary email mailbox.
emailSettings.emailAliasesPrimaryChangeWarning: Changing your primary email may affect app sign-ins.

customDomains.customDomainsDescriptionInitial: Use your own domain to create personalized email addresses.
customDomains.customDomainsDescriptionAdd: Adding a domain you own to your account allows you to create aliases using your custom domains.
customDomains.domainHelp: Enter your existing domain from registrars like GoDaddy, Namecheap, Google Domains or another registrar.
customDomains.verifyStepTitle: Next Step: Add your Thundermail DNS records
customDomains.verifyStepOne: 1. Log in to your domain registrar (e.g. GoDaddy, Namecheap, or Google Domains) and go to the DNS settings for your domain.
customDomains.verifyStepTwo: 2. Delete the following DNS records to your domain – including MX, TXT and SRV records (if present).
customDomains.verifyStepThree: 3. To route your email and services correctly, add the MX, TXT, and SRV records below to your domain’s DNS settings. Be sure to enter them exactly as shown.
customDomains.verifyStepNote: {'Note: Some registrars don’t accept @ for the root domain. If that’s the case, leave the Name/Host field empty.'}
customDomains.verifyStepInfoDescription: Once you start verification, we’ll keep trying automatically for a few days. If it doesn’t succeed in that time, we’ll stop and you’ll need to restart the process manually.

manageMfa.multiFactorAuthenticationDescription: Multi-factor authentication (MFA) adds an extra layer of security by requiring more than a password to sign in. We recommend setting up at least two methods to avoid lockout. You can change or remove MFA methods anytime on this screen.

description.set: One-time codes are generated by your authenticator app.
description.notSet: Set an authenticator app to add an extra layer of security to your account.

verifyYourIdentity.title: Verify your identity
verifyYourIdentity.description: To keep your account secure, please verify your identity before making changes to sensitive information.
verifyYourIdentity.authenticatorAppDescription: Use your authenticator app to generate and enter a recovery code.

manageAuthenticatorApp.title: Manage Authenticator App
manageAuthenticatorApp.description: Open your authenticator app and scan the QR code to link it to your account.
manageAuthenticatorApp.descriptionTwo: This device will be remembered, so next time you sign in, you won’t need to scan again. Just enter the one-time code from your app.
manageAuthenticatorApp.qrNote: Setting up a new authenticator app will remove your current one.
manageAuthenticatorApp.authenticatorAppCodeDescription: Enter the code from your authenticator app:

manageEmailRecovery.title: Manage Email Recovery
manageEmailRecovery.description: Enter your email to receive an authentication code. Once you get a message with the code, select continue.

privacyAndData.deleteAccountDataText: This will permanently delete your Thunderbird Pro account and all data. You cannot reactivate your account.
privacyAndData.deleteAccountWill: Deleting your Thunderbird Pro account will:
privacyAndData.deleteAccountWillOne: Permanently erase your account and all data (emails, contacts, attachments, events, passwords, files).
privacyAndData.deleteAccountWillTwo: Log you out of all devices and end access to Thunderbird Pro services.
privacyAndData.deleteAccountImportantOne: Deleting your data does not cancel your subscription. Unsubscribe first to stop billing and service access.
privacyAndData.deleteAccountImportantTwo: After X days, all data will be erased and your Thundermail address may be reassigned. Emails sent during this time will be rejected.
privacyAndData.deleteAccountExport: Export anything you want to keep before continuing.
privacyAndData.deleteAccountCheckbox: I understand my data will be permanently deleted
